tag_professor: Respected (5)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Participation matters (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
stu_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS  RESPECTED  TEST HEAVY
comments: Great professor who not only knows his material but practices what he preaches. He\'s really into sports and brings a great perspective. Hard subject, easy class but he grades a lot harder than most of the teachers here. You\'ll learn a lot if you put in a half decent effort. Hard compared to the rest of the school.

stu_tags: RESPECTED  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: Good class. Show up for class, study, and you\'ll be fine. Anatomy is hard, but he\'ll help you out if you just ask. Don\'t need the text. Everything is from the lectures.

tag_professor: Respected (5)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Participation matters (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  GRADED BY FEW THINGS  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES
comments: Flies through powerpoints that are extremely difficult to follow. Hardly ever responds to emails. He frequently makes mistakes on quizzes, tells the students he will gives them the points, but never edits the grades. Has you do a 10 page paper with a 15 minute presentation with zero guidelines. Sure, he is a nice guy. Not very good at his job tho

comments: Dr. Heikkinen\'s background really shines in this class. It is clear he knows what he is talking about. Sometimes he seems nervous teaching but overall he is very clear and as long as you show up to class you will do well. Expectations are pretty straightforward.

comments: Really great guy, sometimes gets way off topic with stories. Not many assignments or tests, in fact, I think my entire grade was from two tests. Would prefer more grades to even out test anxiety.

comments: A really, really nice guy who seems to genuinely know a huge amount about exercise and fitness. Not at all a meathead jerk, just a prof. who really seems to want students to learn and get healthier. Highly recommended.
